definition: to assume full responsibility/to be in full control/to monopolize
to monopolize/to seize/to take into one's arms/to embrace/to fasten (with a rope etc)/to take on (responsibility etc)/to canvass

sentences.english: We should unswervingly uphold the poverty alleviation policy to lead all rural works in the poverty-stricken areas.
sentences.chinese: 堅持以扶貧攻堅總攬貧困地區農村工作全局。

sentences.english: We must find someone to take control of the project.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須要找到一個人來總攬這個計劃。

sentences.english: We must find someone to take charge of the project.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須要找到一個人來總攬這個計劃。

sentences.english: Figure 3. The figure above shows the class overview.
